page.title: 11AN ILSON STORY
page.content:
{This is a story written in Ilkeston {dialect by Nicky Clizzard (aged 10).}
Today Albert Henshaw were guing on aldees but Albert ovverlayd. So his mam shouted{"Get up, you're lozzin {abairt."}They left at ten and got theer at twelve but it were rainin so Albert started scraitin and bein mardy. They went to the penny arcade which cheard Albert up. When it stopped rainin Albert and Fred, his dad, went to the beach to look for crabs because tide were out. When they were haif a mile away the tide were comin in. Fred said{"Wey {raight ere, let's run."}When they got to the house Albert sed{"Can anyone {borrer us a towel?"}Albert got dried, put his feet up, ad a cup of tea and a bit of black puddin.
